definition: to visit the bereaved to offer one's condolences
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: He does not wear black lambskin or black headdress when attending a funeral.
sentences.chinese: 黑色羔裘，黑色冠冕，不穿去弔喪。

sentences.english: Then man goes to his eternal home and mourners go about the streets.
sentences.chinese: 因爲人歸他永遠的家，弔喪的在街上往來。

sentences.english: On that day, Confucius would weep and do not sing.
sentences.chinese: 孔子在這天爲弔喪哀哭過，就不唱歌。

sentences.english: I dwelt as a king among his troops; I was like one who comforts mourners .
sentences.chinese: 我如君王在軍隊中居住，又如弔喪的安慰傷心的人。
